channel.title: Java Bug System
channel.description: This file is an XML representation of an issue

item.title: [JDK-8307318] Test serviceability/sa/ClhsdbCDSJstackPrintAll.java failed: ArrayIndexOutOfBoundsException
item.description:
stderr: [Error: java.lang.ArrayIndexOutOfBoundsException: -1 2

status.description: A resolution has been taken, and it is awaiting verification by reporter. From here issues are either reopened, or are closed.

comments.comment:
A pull request was submitted for review.
Branch: master
URL: https://git.openjdk.org/jdk17u-dev/pull/3395
Date: 2025-03-20 20:24:02 +0000

Fix request [21u,17u]

This fix addresses two bugs. For details see JDK-8343529.

A pull request was submitted for review.
Branch: master
URL: https://git.openjdk.org/jdk21u-dev/pull/1519
Date: 2025-03-18 13:55:28 +0000

Changeset: 21e0fb86
Branch: master
Author: Chris Plummer <cjplummer@openjdk.org>
Date: 2024-11-22 17:26:37 +0000
URL: https://git.openjdk.org/jdk/commit/21e0fb8648d61f041a04d44ad6c46fc5efd86261

A pull request was submitted for review.
Branch: master
URL: https://git.openjdk.org/jdk/pull/22123
Date: 2024-11-14 22:15:29 +0000

My guess is that the issue is that the target VM has active threads, so the state is unpredicatable, and we are just catching the thread while some critical data is in an inconsistent state. At the very least you can see in the output that the main thread is running:

"main" #1 prio=5 tid=0x00007f246802d030 nid=3648388 runnable [0x00007f2472a20000]
   java.lang.Thread.State: RUNNABLE
   JavaThread state: _thread_in_vm
 - sun.nio.fs.UnixNativeDispatcher.fstat0(int, sun.nio.fs.UnixFileAttributes) @bci=0, pc=0x00007f2457c1d93a, Method*=0x00007f23f24fc298 (Interpreted frame)
 - sun.nio.fs.UnixNativeDispatcher.fstat(int, sun.nio.fs.UnixFileAttributes) @bci=2, line=283, pc=0x00007f2457c16e08, Method*=0x00007f23f24fb9e8 (Interpreted frame)
 - sun.nio.fs.UnixFileAttributes.get(int) @bci=10, line=100, pc=0x00007f2457c16e08, Method*=0x00007f23f24fe730 (Interpreted frame)
 - sun.nio.fs.UnixFileAttributeViews$Basic.setTimes(java.nio.file.attribute.FileTime, java.nio.file.attribute.FileTime, java.nio.file.attribute.FileTime) @bci=160, line=108, pc=0x00007f2457c16fa2, Method*=0x00007f23f2500060 (Interpreted frame)
 - java.nio.file.Files.setLastModifiedTime(java.nio.file.Path, java.nio.file.attribute.FileTime) @bci=23, line=2448, pc=0x00007f2457c17316, Method*=0x00007f23f237af48 (Interpreted frame)
 - jdk.test.lib.apps.LingeredApp.setLastModified(java.lang.String, long) @bci=18, line=216, pc=0x00007f2457c16fa2, Method*=0x00007f23ee402580 (Interpreted frame)
 - jdk.test.lib.apps.LingeredApp.main(java.lang.String[]) @bci=152, line=629, pc=0x00007f2457c16e08, Method*=0x00007f23ee403e10 (Interpreted frame)
- locked <0x00000000d952aa30> (a jdk.test.lib.apps.LingeredApp$SteadyStateLock)

The test should be modified to not fail when these errors pop up.

The above failure is a bit different in that it also has the following exception after all the AIOOBE exceptions:

sun.jvm.hotspot.utilities.AssertionFailure: Corrupted constant pool: 108 ConstantTag:1
at jdk.hotspot.agent/sun.jvm.hotspot.utilities.Assert.that(Assert.java:32)

> Here's another similar failure mode for this test:
>
>JDK-8295381 serviceability/sa/ClhsdbCDSJstackPrintAll.java fails with "Error: java.lang.IndexOutOfBoundsException: Index 0 out of bounds for length 0"

This is IndexOutOfBoundsException, not ArrayIndexOutOfBoundsException, and for reasons that seem unrelated to this CR.

I've been unable to reproduce this after about 2000 runs. I used the same two builds, command line arguments, and test suites that initially reproduced this issue.
